title: I keep getting DC'd in the home screen,lobby and while queueing...
body:
As the title says I keep getting DC'd and no it's nnot my connection (I checked and I have the best possible conncetion for my area)
It's frustrating...I have gotten queue dodge timers and i'm just triggered at this point...
I reinstalled the game,used the hextech repair tool and changed my DNS to the google one and all of them showed no signs of fixing the DCing.
And when it doesnt DC and I manage to queue,the Accept pop-up doesn't pop up.
Someone please help me I have never been so frustrated...

http://prntscr.com/hht2oy - Happens every 2-3 minutes

replies.body: Your ISP connection might be stellar, but your local network can still run into snags.  I hate to say it, but it does sound like your network is unstable, and cutting you off from the client and matchmaking.  I highly recommend going over the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to help clear this up.

http://prntscr.com/hhtcil

thats the score and it seems like a preety good one so yeah... :<

Your ISP score may be solid, but it doesn't mean there aren't issues while leaving your network to route to it.  For some more visibility, download [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/winmtr-v0-92-now-available/) and run a route to the game server: 192.64.170.252.  Run it for about 5 minutes, remove the IP on the first two rows, and let me know what you find.  

There could totally be something else going on, but all of your symptoms are showing signs of an unstable connection, do this poro a solid and help me rule out that possibility.  <3

Im not exactly sure what I'm supposed to do in the programm.
Paste the IP in the host tab?

Aye, you'll want to put the IP into the Host panel, hit Start, and let it run for about 5 minutes.  You should get a list of how you're routing to the game server.  Should be a few rows until you reach riotdirect (hopefully).  Correction though, you'll want to route to **192.64.170.252**, the EUW game server.  Sorry about that!

Hey thanks for this!  Can you also run a route for the EUW game server: 192.64.170.252.  Looking at this so far, it looks like your ISP is causing a pretty huge delay, but that just may be because it's routing to NA.

Here's the other result:

Thanks!  So there's two things happening here.  In your first route to NA, you had packet loss which suggests that instability I mentioned earlier.  In this route to EUW, it looks like you've got a port block so your router isn't leaving your network.  I recommend using the [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) to auto-configure your firewall settings, and steps in that connection guide which includes steps on port forwarding.
I have done the port forwarding and the hextech tool yet it doensn't seen to have helped the rankdom disconnects and not being able to see the ACCEPT pop up.

I see...This is a weird case then.  Any chance of anti-virus settings, or on your router itself?  If none of that helps, reach out to us in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).  The HRT should provide some logs, attach them in that ticket so our tech team can get more context and find some more options for you.  Sorry I couldn't personally be more help here, but they'll be able to dig deeper!

I submitted a suppoer ticket hopefully they'll be able to help me :)

Still thanks for trying to help me <3
You aren't the only one having this issue. A bunch of people from all over, including myself, have been having this issue since yesterday.

Hey, this is news to me!  Who's your ISP?  Can you run a traceroute as well to the NA game server so I can take a closer look?  104.160.131.1

If there's something going on, I'd like to know report the situation.
